meanings.definition: To engulf or swallow up completely.
meanings.sent1: The huge wave gulfed the tiny boat, pulling it under the water.
meanings.sent2: The darkness gulfed the room as the lights went out.
meanings.sent3: The hungry puppy gulfed down his food in seconds, leaving no crumbs behind.
meanings.sent4: The sadness gulfed her heart like a storm cloud, making it hard to see any light.
meanings.sent5: The flames gulfed the old house, leaving only ashes behind.

meanings.definition: To be surrounded or overwhelmed by something.
meanings.sent1: She felt gulfed by the crowd of people pushing around her in the busy market.
meanings.sent2: The small village was gulfed by the vast forest that surrounded it.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked gulfed by the pile of yarn it had accidentally unraveled.
meanings.sent4: His mind was gulfed by thoughts of the upcoming exam, making it hard to focus on anything else.
meanings.sent5: The city was gulfed by a thick fog, hiding the tall buildings from view.
